intro: Gonostemon praetermissus, commonly known as the slender-stemmed gonostemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. Its flowers are typically small, yellowish-green, and clustered in inflorescences at the leaf axils. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
